snippet: Defense Secretary Philip Hammond outlined a major restructuring of the country’s armed forces on Thursday as the military prepares to lose 20,000 soldiers.
abstract: Defense Secretary Philip Hammond of Great Britain outlines a major restructuring of the country’s armed forces as the military prepares to lose 20,000 soldiers; the army is shrinking to 82,000 troops from 102,000 by the end of the decade due to cuts in government spending.
lead_paragraph: Defense Secretary Philip Hammond outlined a major restructuring of the country’s armed forces on Thursday as the military prepares to lose 20,000 soldiers.
